pullRequest.body:
```lean
example : nat_lit 0 = nat_lit 0 := by
  cc
-- failed

example : "Miyahara Kō" = "Miyahara Kō" := by
  cc (config := { values := false })
-- failed
```
The cause of this error is that code on `Mathlib.Tactic.CC.CCM.internalizeAppLit` from L1222 onwards doesn't assume that the input is `Expr.lit`.
This error can be fixed simply by adding `unless e.isApp do return`.
Also, we add a test for this bug.

p.s. This is an new error in Lean 4 because Lean 3 has no `Expr.lit` so we doesn't have to fix code in Lean 3.

---

nodes.body:
> Unfortunately the following doesn't seem to work:
> 
> ```lean
> example : nat_lit 0 = nat_lit 0 := by
>   cc
> ```
This works, as you can see in `test/cc.lean`.

Did you mean this?
```lean
example : nat_lit 0 = 0 := by
  cc
```
I think this is another issue which should be solved in another PR.

> Did you mean this?

Oops, sorry, yes!

Could you explain why this is a different error to be fixed in another PR? It seems like the problem is that one class of natural literals is not processed the same way as another.

Even if we fix `nat_lit` problem, this bug occurs in this form:
```lean
example : "Anne Baanen" = "Anne Baanen" := by
  cc (config := { values := false })
-- failed
```
I changed the title and the description, and added the new test.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9300744376/job/25597447549)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9300744376/job/25597447311)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9300744376/job/25597446444)

I see. Okay, then let's merge this fix.

bors r+

Unfortunately the following doesn't seem to work:

```lean
example : nat_lit 0 = nat_lit 0 := by
  cc
```

I think the correct fix is to check `e.isRawNatLit` and if so, replace `e` with an expression shaped like `(OfNat.ofNat _ e)`.

I see. Okay, then let's merge this fix.

bors r+

```suggestion
  -- At this point we should have handled a literal; otherwise we fail.
  unless e.isApp do return
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - fix(Mathlib/Tactic/CC/Addition): `cc` tactic throws error for literals

source.title: `cc` tactic can't unify def-eq instances in `OfNat.ofNat`

nodes.body:
Unfortunately the following doesn't seem to work:

```lean
example : nat_lit 0 = nat_lit 0 := by
  cc
```

I think the correct fix is to check `e.isRawNatLit` and if so, replace `e` with an expression shaped like `(OfNat.ofNat _ e)`.

> Unfortunately the following doesn't seem to work:
>

>   cc

This works, as you can see in `test/cc.lean`.

Did you mean this?

```lean
example : nat_lit 0 = 0 := by
  cc
```
I think this is another issue which should be solved in another PR.

> Did you mean this?

Oops, sorry, yes!

Could you explain why this is a different error to be fixed in another PR? It seems like the problem is that one class of natural literals is not processed the same way as another.

Even if we fix `nat_lit` problem, this bug occurs in this form:
```lean
example : "Anne Baanen" = "Anne Baanen" := by
  cc (config := { values := false })
-- failed
```
I changed the title and the description, and added the new test.

I see. Okay, then let's merge this fix.

bors r+
